channel.title: Modern game like Half-Life 2: Episode 2
channel.description:
Hello,
I am open to suggestions on which game to play, as a reference
I choose Episode 2 of Half-Life 2 series (it has great immersive at-
mosphere, that not even Metro 2033 can keep up to [in my eyes])
, but the game has to have newer graphics. I am tired of looking
on the Internet for the preferred one, and am hoping to get a hint
on the topic here, dear forum-people.
Currently I am playing both Metro 2033 (for the third time), and Half-Life: Episode 2 (first
time, after I have seen some of the walkthrough videos on Youtube). I strongly recommend Metro 2033
to those who like Half-Life 2 series of games.

item.title: Modern game like Half-Life 2: Episode 2
item.dc:creator: HaarWavelet
item.description:
I found that NFS The Run game with steering wheel is on par with Episode 2, when it comes to the level of execution. But I have gotten a small problem, and would like help on it, if possible: with steering wheel in it the automatic transmission is not working properly, and pushes me onto using manual, which is an issue to me(I am not a good game driver). On the Internet I found no solution to it, and am asking for help here. I do not think that it deserves a separate topic.

Read full topic

item.title: Modern game like Half-Life 2: Episode 2
item.dc:creator: HaarWavelet
item.description:
deadlife101

Well, to me the settings look as interesting, and detailed. Also, with the gamepad it is (to me) it is as interesting to play (walkthrough videos might be misleading until you try to play with the gamepad yourself). And (also my opinion) variety of situations is even more densely placed in terms of timeline than that of the “Half-Life 2: Episode 2”.

Read full topic

item.title: Modern game like Half-Life 2: Episode 2
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
I think Singularity deserves a place in this thread. The story is a lot cheesier, but still enjoyable, and the storytelling methods are in the same vein as Half-Life’s. Also, trapping enemies in deadlocks and pumping them full of bullets in slo-mo never gets old.

Read full topic

item.title: Modern game like Half-Life 2: Episode 2
item.dc:creator: deadlife101
item.description:
HaarWavelet:

I found “Gears of War 2” on “Xbox 360” to be very entertaining, as good as the “Half Life 2: Episode 2”.

I’m sorry but I don’t think Gears of War is comparable to any Half-Life game but that’s just my opinion.

If you’re really itching for more Half-Life you should make sure that you’ve played every Half-Life game and expansion, and look on Moddb.com for Half-Life mods, there’s good stuff that is similar to Half-Life there of course.

Read full topic

item.description:
You should try Bioshock Infinite. Had a ton of fun with it, and imo it’s kinda stuck between HL2 and Systemshock.

item.title: Modern game like Half-Life 2: Episode 2
item.dc:creator: HaarWavelet
item.description:
Recently had acquired a “TimeShift” game, and am as happy as ever! What a game (graphics are a

bit dated in terms of lighting, but the density of visual geometry is great)!

Gameplay wise I see it on par with “Half-Life 2” game, in its own way!

Read full topic

item.title: Modern game like Half-Life 2: Episode 2
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Prey was kinda fun. I liked the very “alien” feel of the environments and the weapons. I mean, this is a game where the basic “assault rifle” style weapon has a scope that ATTACHES TO YOUR FUCKING EYEBALL.

item.title: Modern game like Half-Life 2: Episode 2
item.dc:creator: Shaddy
item.description:
I feel like Portal 2 drags on a bit, but I enjoy the humor and characters far more than in Portal 1, so I can excuse it (although at this point I’ve nearly memorized a lot of the scenes to the point it kinda loses the charm).

item.title: Modern game like Half-Life 2: Episode 2
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Lemonz&oranges:

portal 1 is more like hl2ep2 as it utilyzed the exact same engine version (it even still has code for the hl2 guns which can be spawned with console command cheats)

That’s technically true, but I’d argue that Portal 2 is a lot better for story-telling and exploration.

Read full topic

item.title: Modern game like Half-Life 2: Episode 2
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
Dishonored would be a great one, especially if you liked the setting for the half life 2 and episodes arc. I swear, I felt like I was in city 17 sometimes, just after the citadel collapse.
